article:
A loop in mathematics, in a topological space X is a path f from the unit
interval I = [0,1] to X such that f(0) = f(1). In other words, it is a
path whose initial point is equal to the terminal point.

A loop may also be seen as a continuous map f from the unit circle S 1
into X, because S 1 may be regarded as a quotient of I under the
identification 0 â¼ 1.

The set of all loops in X forms a space called the loop space of X.
